title: Art Insights: All Art Creatures Great and Small
hero_caption: Édouard Manet. The Races at Longchamp, 1866. Potter Palmer Collection.
description:
Art Insights provides a historical and enlightening art-enrichment experience for older members of the community who may be unable to visit the Art Institute in person. The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Mather LifeWays Telephone Topics to provide telephone-based Art Insights conversations on a national scale. A telephone is required to participate in this program.

It has been written that "art is continually haunted by the animal." Artists across time have represented the wild kingdom and our familiar companions in sport, leisure, labor, play, and prowl. Art Institute of Chicago volunteer lecturer Laura Davis leads a lively conversation about depictions and interpretations of animals in art.

This telephone presentation is hosted by Mather Lifeways, a nondenominational, not-for-profit organization dedicated to serving older adults. For more information or to register, please call (888) 600-2560 or email teltopics@matherlifeways.com.

This program is available via telephone only and is not offered on-site. Persons with disabilities who would like to visit the museum and experience an on-site program may request an accessibility accommodation by sending an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
buy_button_caption:
Free, registration required

To register, please call (888) 600-2560 or email teltopics@matherlifeways.com.
